item.title: My Recent Fascination with the IndieWeb
How to Build a Gaming PC Under $250
What Are Reliability, Scalability, and Maintainability in Distributed Systems?
Implementing Pipeline from the SciKit Learn Module
item.description: I’m continuing learning NLP. In this notebook, I give an example of the Pipeline class for preprocessing and model fitting. I’m using the fetch_20newsgroups dataset from sklearn.datasets. You can find the code here.

item.title: Setting Up my PiHole, a Short Story
item.description: I just couldn’t take answering surveys on my smart TV anymore.

item.title: Implementing LDA in Python
item.description: Definition Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) is a modelling technique used for NLP. I’m following along on this kaggle notebook to learn and explain these two techniques. Code I have uploaded the jupyter file here. And that’s how you do it. I’m not entirely sure how it works yet either, but I am learning!

item.title: Running Spark Applications on Dockerized Spark
How to Use uBlock Origin to Limit Distractions
item.description: uBlock Origin is usually used to block unwanted ads. But it is also a powerful tool to increase productivity.

item.title: Flow: How Working from Home Has Made Me Productive
item.description: Working from home has been a boon for my productivity.

item.title: How to Get OpenJFX Working in Eclipse
item.description: Get the power of JavaFX working in Eclipse. Without the licensing requirements of Oracle JDK.

item.title: Create a New Hugo Site on Netlify in 7 Easy Steps
item.description: Hugo is a great static site generator. Netlify is an amazing host for static sites. Let’s combine the power of them.

item.title: Java Programming is 90% Easier with Project Lombok
item.description:
Writing in Java is a pain in the butt. Even simple code is verbose. Project Lombok condenses Java syntax. This reduction can be up to 90% of normal java code.

Let’s see how Lombok does this.

item.title: The Chain of Responsibility Pattern Makes Hard Validation Easy
item.description: I like my validation workflow the same way I like my IKEA tables. Easy to setup and with a cool name. Though the Chain of Responsibility is no Godfjord, it is pretty easy to use.
